definitions.definition: An irregular line left from smearing or motion .
examples: The picture I took out the car window had streaks .

definitions.definition: A continuous series of like events.
examples: I hope I can keep up this streak of accomplishments.
I was on a winning streak until the fourth game, when I was dealt terrible cards.

subdefinitions.definition: A measure of activity that tracks how many consecutive days a certain interaction with another user or a service has taken place, a form of gamification to drive user engagement.

definitions.definition: A consistent facet of somebody's personality .
The color of the powder of a mineral . So called, because a simple field test for a mineral is to streak it against unglazed white porcelain.
A moth of the family Geometridae , Chesias legatella .
A tendency or characteristic , but not a dominant or pervasive one.
examples: She's a quiet, bookish person, but she has a rebellious streak .

definitions.definition: A rung or round of a ladder .
The act of streaking, or running naked through a public area.
